availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Covington, Kentucky, lawyer. New Liberty, Kentucky native. Son of James O’Hara, Sr. and Lucy O’Hara. Attended law school at St. Mary’s College in Marion County, Kentucky. Married to Oberia O’ Hara. Father of Susannah O’Hara. Resident in Williamstown, Kentucky in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in 1850. Lawyer in Covington in 1860. Formed a law partnership with John G. Carlisle from 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 6.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington, Ward 4, page 193.
Kentucky Death Records, Covington, 1900, film 7013567, no. 736.
H. Levin, The Lawyers and Lawmakers of Kentucky (Chicago: The Lewis Publishing Company, 1897), 757-759.
Find A Grave, "James O’Hara (1825-1900)," Memorial #84402453, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84402453/james-o'hara# (accessed September 5, 2018).
